subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 270921
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
221 AM PDT FRI APR 27 2007

..HIGH SURF CONTINUING ON EXPOSED WEST FACING SHORES...

HIGH SURF WILL CONTINUE AND STRONG RIP CURRENTS WILL PERSIST
ALONG EXPOSED WEST FACING SHORES THROUGH THIS MORNING. A LARGE
NORTHWEST SWELL WILL BRING THE HIGHEST SURF CONDITIONS TO THE
COASTAL AREAS OF SAN LUIS OBISPO AND WESTERN SANTA BARBARA
COUNTIES. DUE TO THE LONGER PERIOD OF THE SWELL...SOME OF THIS
ENERGY WILL SPREAD INTO THE INNER COASTAL WATERS...RESULTING IN
HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF CONDITIONS ACROSS WEST FACING BEACHES OF
LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES.

CAZ034-035-271700-
/O.EXT.KLOX.SU.Y.0007.000000T0000Z-070427T1700Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
221 AM PDT FRI APR 27 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS CONTINUED THE
HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL COAST. THIS ADVISORY IS NOW IN
EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING...AND INCLUDES THE WEST FACING
SHORES OF SAN LUIS OBISPO AND SANTA BARBARA COUNTY.

10 TO 12 FOOT SURF WILL CONTINUE THROUGH LATE MORNING ALONG THE
CENTRAL COAST...WITH THE HIGHEST SURF OCCURRING ON THE WEST AND
NORTHWEST FACING BEACHES. THE SURF IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN SUBSIDING
LATER TODAY.

A HIGH SURF ADVISORY MEANS THAT HIGH SURF WILL AFFECT BEACHES IN THE
ADVISORY AREA...PRODUCING STRONG RIP CURRENTS AND LOCALIZED BEACH
EROSION. ALL PERSONS SHOULD BE AWARE OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH
WATER RELATED ACTIVITIES AND USE EXTREME CAUTION WHEN ENTERING THE
OCEAN. WHEN IN DOUBT...JUST STAY OUT.

$$

CAZ040-041-271700-
/O.EXT.KLOX.CF.S.0006.000000T0000Z-070427T1700Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
221 AM PDT FRI APR 27 2007

..HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF CONTINUES AT WEST FACING BEACHES...

ABOVE NORMAL SURF CONTINUES AT THE LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY
BEACHES THIS MORNING. 4 TO 6 FOOT SURF WITH LOCAL SETS TO 7 FEET
CAN BE EXPECTED AT WEST FACING BEACHES THROUGH LATE THIS MORNING.
SURF WILL CONTINUE TO DIMINISH THROUGHOUT TODAY.

THE HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY PRODUCE STRONG
RIP CURRENTS. ALL PERSONS SHOULD BE AWARE OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED
WITH WATER RELATED ACTIVITIES AND USE EXTREME CAUTION WHEN ENTERING
THE OCEAN. WHEN IN DOUBT...JUST STAY OUT.

$$

HALL
